history.text: have you checked out The Wolf of Wall Street yet?
Yeah, definitely! It had Leo in it.
I think it is Leo's greatest role. Did he win an oscar for it?
No, I don't think he did. He should have, though. Did you like Margot Robbie as Naomi?
Margot Robbie is one of my faves she was great. And Jonah hill too!
would you consider it a black comedy?
I'm not sure. Leo was a lead and he's white, so I'm 50/50 on it.
What's your opinion?
I know it is labeled a black comedy, so I will go with that. We aren't the only ones that liked it. It has a 78% rating on rotten tomatoes
That's a pretty good rating. It's interesting that it deals with such serious concepts like corruption and is still a comedy.
One of my favorite directors is Martin Scorsese and he directed this film. It's a pretty crazy movie for an old director like him.
You're right! It did get some pretty harsh criticism but I think it had some interesting characters.
New York is certainly always an interesting location.
I like that it is set in the late 80's and love seeing how he takes the negative of being fired after black monday and then creates an empire
That's pretty cool. It has a pretty solid plotline, I think.

I think one of the parts
 I like the most is actually how Leo was also a producer, while acting in it.
I didn't realize he was a producer. Good for him.
The film came out five years ago, in 2013. Seems like it came out sooner!
Doesn't it? Maybe it's because of the topic and way it was directed..
I remember at one point in the film he makes $22 million in three hours! Illegal, but I'm still jealous!
Oh man, haha! Me too. He went and tried to hide it later on - totally risky move.
That's what started his downfall...It got the FBI interested in him. I like how he used Aunt Emma to help hide the cash.
I forgot that Kyle Chandler is in the film too. He played the FBI agent.
Me too. It was a smart move! I think that it shows how people will go to great lengths to stay rich.
Oh yeah, he did, didn't he? I think he pulled off the role well.

It sucks that he got pulled into hard
 drugs, though.
It's funny how Leo smuggled the cash into Switzerland. That's where everyone hides their money it seems!
It is! You always hear about Switzerland bank accounts and offshores... I guess Jordan heard the same.
He did get arrested for all of it, though. Unfortunately for him...
yeah, but he only had to serve three years, and at a minimum security prison. seems pretty leniant of a sentence to me.
That does seem pretty lenient. It was irresponsible of him to take his daughter during his freakout, too.
yeah, but he had lost his mind a bit. what did you think of Donnie ratting out on Jordan to the FBI?
I thought that it wasn't surprising but it was also a real jerk move.
Jordan tried to help him out but he totally narced on him! Really fickle friendship, that.
I guess the movie had a happy ending. he was out of jail and making a living with this seminars.
Oh, that is nice for him. Seems to show that people can change for the better.
all this talk makes me want to rewatch the film. have you seen it more than once?
Nope, just once, and it was a little blurry til now. I'd totally forgotten that it was a minimum security prison.
Or that he got divorced a second time..
I don't recall 2 divorces. but a good movie and margot robbie to look at. it's worth a second look!

uid1response.feedback: I don't remember much at all about it except that Leo's face was looking nice as usual but I guess that's a good thing for this task!
